meanings.sent1: I will survey the map to find the hidden treasure.
meanings.sent2: The detective will survey the crime scene for clues.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat decided to survey the mysterious box in the corner.
meanings.sent4: She surveyed the painting with a critical eye, looking for any flaws.
meanings.sent5: The scientist will survey the data to draw meaningful conclusions.

meanings.definition: A general view or examination of a subject
meanings.sent1: The aerial survey of the city revealed its layout from above.
meanings.sent2: The survey of customer satisfaction showed high ratings for the product.
meanings.sent3: The survey of the playground equipment made the kids excited for new additions.
meanings.sent4: The survey of the landscape painted a beautiful picture of the countryside.
meanings.sent5: The survey of opinions on the matter varied greatly among the group.

meanings.definition: A detailed study or analysis of a particular subject or area
meanings.sent1: The survey of the ecosystem provided valuable insights for conservation efforts.
meanings.sent2: The survey of the market trends helped the company make informed decisions.
meanings.sent3: The survey of the book's plot twists left the reader in awe.
meanings.sent4: The survey of the ancient ruins uncovered hidden secrets of the past.
meanings.sent5: The survey of the medical records revealed patterns in patient health.
